Description: Terracotta votive figure of a seated woman (Cybele?), wearing chiton and himation. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of white coating with yellow paint surviving. Only left side of leg and chair remain. Red-brown fabric (Nile silt?) with grey core.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Parallel from Naukratis (Gutch 1898-9, 84, pl. XII 74). Late 5th century BC parallel from Halicarnassus (British Museum GR 1857,1220.64; Terracotta 422).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.366) (Phase 3)
